segments.text: I see a woman standing by the sink, completely absorbed in drying a plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She doesn’t even notice the water overflowing onto the floor, pooling around her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her dress is already getting wet, but she doesn’t seem to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’s just too tired to notice anything else.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The way she’s focused on that plate, it’s like the rest of the world doesn’t exist.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a little bad for her—she’s going to have a mess to clean up later.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children behind her are up to no good, but she’s completely oblivious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope she doesn’t slip on that wet floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s almost funny how unaware she is, but it’s also kind of sad.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she might be in her own little world right now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if anyone will tell her about the water before it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR
